creator: kalle@ok.ee
text:
in "et" locale [a-z] is not what it seems, apache configure uses in sed this 
exact scope in critical points. which means, that --prefix=/home/www turns 
(instead of /home/www) to --prefix/home/www in script, same goes to --with-
layout=Apache, which becomes --with-layoutApache

it annoys, and took me more than an hour to find the problem at first place, 
then change my locale, and then everything worked as magick.

regs,
cal6

btw, in estonian dictionary, z is right after s, and before t.

test site was mandrake 8.2 with global et console, also didn't work in redhat 
7.2 under same circumstanses.
creator: kalle@ok.ee

text:
I've noticed a similar problem under FreeBSD, using a German locale.  The
src/Configure script used to create things like

#ifdef ÚNISUD_H

where it was supposed to create

#ifdef UNISTD_H

It turned out that using tr '[a-z]' '[A-Z]' appears to be only a valid assumption
in the "C" locale.  IMHO, tr '[:lower:]' '[:upper:]' should always be preferred
if available.
creator: bugs@ida.interface-business.de

text: Fixed in 2.0, autoconf unsets locale environment automatically.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
